type.description: The MIME type of the build file asset

content.description: The source code of the build file asset.

brand.description: The brand prefixed before the component tag name.

fs.description: The file system being used to read/write files.

emitter.description: The NodeJS EventEmitter instance being used.

minify?.description: Whether to minify the generated JavaScript code.

tsconfig?.description: The location of the used tsconfig.json.

source.description: The file path where names are imported from.
Returns the generated JavaScript source code.

TempleDocument.description: Returns a server document class that can be instantiated.

document.description: Returns the default instantiated document used to render the final HTML markup.

buildPath.description: The absolute path the build directory

manifestFile?.description: The name of the manifest file.

environment?.description: The environment mode that will determine the cache strategy.

ast.description: Returns an abstract syntax tree (AST) interpretation of the component.

brand.description: Returns the brand prefixed before the component tag name.

classname.description: Returns the suggested class name of the component.

components.description: Returns a list of child components imported by this component.

contents.description: Returns the raw temple source code.

cwd.description: Returns the project's current working directory (cwd).

dependencies.description: Returns all the files this component imports sorted by type.

dirname.description: Returns the directory name where this component file exists.

fs.description: Returns the file system being used to read/write files.

id.description: Returns a unique component ID used for build files.

imports.description: Returns the files imported by this component. This does not include any component files.

markup.description: Returns the markup abstract syntax tree.

loader.description: Returns the file loader used to resolve paths of imported files.

parent.description: Returns the parent component, if any.

registry.description: Returns all child components and sub-child components.

relative.description: Returns the source file path relative to the current working directory (cwd).

source.description: Returns the source file path. This may or may not be the absolute path.

scripts.description: Returns all the collective JavaScript in the temple source file.

styles.description: Returns all the collective CSS styles in the temple source file.

tagname.description: Returns the suggested HTML tag name.

type.description: Returns type of component. Will transpile depending on the type.

render.description: Triggers before the document is rendered.

rendered.description: Triggers after the document is rendered.

build.description: Triggers before the document is built.

built.description: Triggers after the document is built.

build-client.description: Triggers before the client js is rendered.

built-client.description: Triggers after the client js is rendered.

build-server.description: Triggers before the server js is rendered.

built-server.description: Triggers after the server js is rendered.

build-styles.description: Triggers before the css styles are rendered.

built-styles.description: Triggers after the css styles is rendered.

manifest-load.description: Triggers before the manifest is loaded.

manifest-resolve.description: Triggers before a build ID is resolved.

manifest-resolved.description: Triggers after a build ID/entry is set.

manifest-unresolved.description: Triggers after a build ID is deleted.

emitter.description: The NodeJS EventEmitter instance being used.

registry.description: The manifest registry used to map build IDs to document entry files.

builder.description: Returns a document builder given the build id.

delete.description: Removes an entry file from the manifest given the build id.

entries.description: Returns an array of build IDs and entry file paths.

get.description: Returns the entry file path given the build id.

has.description: Returns true if the build id exists in the manifest.

load.description: Loads an entire manifest object to the registry.

keys.description: Returns an array of build IDs.

set.description: Sets an entry file path to the manifest given the build id.

toJson.description: Returns the manifest as a JSON string.

values.description: Returns an array of entry file paths.

directive.description: Adds a directive that transpiles custom markup tags like if/elif/else, each, try/catch.

DocumentTranspiler.description: Converts a temple file to server-side JavaScript.

document.description: Returns a document component with various meta information, used for transpilation.

emitter.description: The NodeJS EventEmitter instance being used.

extnames.description: Returns the file extensions that are recognized to parse as Temple components.

transpiler.description: Returns a transpiler used to convert a temple file to server-side JavaScript.

tsconfig.description: Returns the location of the used tsconfig.json.

build.description: Generates the server-side component and brings it into the runtime.

component.description: Generates the source file as an independent component.
Returns the component tag name and class name.

new.description: Instantiates the server document class on the server-side used to render the final HTML.

id.description: Returns a unique document ID used to map the build cache.

styles.description: Returns the css styles for this document.

template.description: Returns an array of Element children and sub-children.

render.description: Returns the final document HTML markup.

brand?.description: The brand prefixed before the component tag name.

fs?.description: The file system being used to read/write files.
fs?.example:
import fs from 'fs';

const compiler = temple({ fs });'

emitter?.description: The NodeJS EventEmitter instance being used.
emitter?.example:
import emitter from 'events';

const compiler = temple({ emitter });'

minify?.description: Whether to minify the generated JavaScript code.

tsconfig?.description: The location of the used tsconfig.json.

emitter.description: The NodeJS EventEmitter instance being used.

manifest.description: The manifest registry used to map build IDs to document entry files.

fromId.description: Returns a new DocumentBuilder instance given a build ID.

fromCache.description: Returns build information from a compiled template.

fromSource.description: Returns a new DocumentBuilder instance given a template source file.

use.description: Enables a default build cache strategy.

asset.description: Returns a compiled build asset, given an asset file name.

client.description: Returns a compiled client script, given the the template source file.

import.description: Returns build information, given the the template source file.

markup.description: Returns a compiled markup, given the the template source file.

render.description: Returns the final HTML markup, given the the template source file.

server.description: Returns compiled server code, given the the template source file.

styles.description: Returns compiled css styles, given the the template source file.

attr.description: Returns only the valid HTML tag attributes (string and true).

props.description: Returns all the attributes assigned to the component.
props.example: this.props; //--> { disabled: true, count: 4, click: handleClick }

metadata.description: Returns the tag and class name of the component.

styles.description: Returns the css styles used in the component.

template.description: Returns a function that returns an array of elements, text nodes and web components

render.description: Renders the children and returns the final HTML markup.

elements.description: Returns a map of elements used in the DOM.

createComponent.description: Creates a TempleElement from a web component class.

createElement.description: Creates a TempleElement from a string tag name.

createText.description: Creates a TextNode from a raw string.

get.description: Returns a TempleElement given a DOM element.

has.description: Returns true if the given element exists in the registry

map.description: Like array map for registry returns an array of whatever the callback returns.

register.description: Registers a TempleElement to the registry.

attributes.description: Returns all the attributes assigned to the element.

hasAttribute.description: Returns true if the element has the given attribute.

getAttribute.description: Returns the value of the given attribute.

removeAttribute.description: Removes the given attribute from the element.

setAttribute.description: Sets the given attribute to the element.

setAttributes.description: Sets multiple attributes to the element.

emit.description: Emits an event with optional parameters.

once.description: Adds an event listener that only fires once.

BUILD_ID.description: The unique build ID used to map the build cache.

TempleComponent.description: The Temple component class used to create custom elements.

TempleElement.description: The Temple element class used to create custom elements.

TempleEmitter.description: The Temple emitter class used to create custom events.

TempleException.description: The Temple exception class used to create custom errors.

TempleRegistry.description: The Temple registry class used to store custom elements.

children.description: Returns an array of child nodes.

components.description: Returns an object of Temple components classes used in the DOM.

data.description: The Temple data map used to bring server side data to the client.

emitter.description: The Temple emitter class used to create custom events.

props.description: Returns an object of component attributes

signal.description: Returns a signal object used to re-render components whenever its value changes

asset.description: Returns a compiled build asset, given an asset file name.

client.description: Returns a compiled client script, given the the template source file.

markup.description: Returns a compiled markup, given the the template source file.

render.description: Returns the final HTML markup, given the the template source file.

server.description: Returns compiled server code, given the the template source file.

styles.description: Returns compiled css styles, given the the template source file.

cwd?.example: const { refresh, router } = dev({ cwd: process.cwd() })

emitter?.description: The NodeJS EventEmitter instance being used.
emitter?.example:
import emitter from 'events';

const { refresh, router } = dev({ emitter });'

include?.description: An array of extension names to watch for

ignore?.description: An array of extension names to ignore

route?.description: The route path to use for the client watcher

tsconfig?.description: The path to the tsconfig.json file

emitter.description: The NodeJS EventEmitter instance being used.

sync.description: Registers a document builder to a client watcher list

close.description: Closes the server and stops the watchers.

refresh.description: Whenever a file is changed this will be called to instruct each client watcher how to update their document.

wait.description: Opens a connection to the server via SSE and waits for changes.

watch.description: Starts the server that watches for file changes.

refresh.description: The refresh server instance used to update clients.

router.description: HTTP middleware to handle developer tool routes like '/dev.js' and '/__temple_dev__'.

refresh.description: The refresh server instance used to update clients.

router.description: Express middleware to handle developer tool routes like '/dev.js' and '/__temple_dev__'.

view.description: Middleware used to setup an express view engine.
